newsitem.title: USA: Paramount vice chairman to resign.
newsitem.headline: Paramount vice chairman to resign.

text.p: Paramount Pictures Monday said Vice Chairman Barry London has decided to resign.
The studio, which is owned by Viacom Inc., said London will remain in his current position until a successor is named, after which he will enter into a production deal with Paramount Pictures.
In a telephone interview, London said the move was "totally my decision" and not the result of a shake-up at the studio.
"It's something that I've been toying with for a number of years and I think at this stage in my life I've very much excited about the challenge of being a producer on this lot," he said.
He said he hoped to assume his role as producer by the end of the year but there was no specific timetable for his departure.
As vice chairman of the motion pictures group, London was responsible for the studio's theatrical and video marketing and distribution of motion pictures on a worldwide basis.
During his tenure, London supervised the release of some of the studio's biggest hits, including "Forrest Gump", "Braveheart" and "Mission: Impossible".
He became vice chairman of the Motion Picture Group in October of 1994.
